main.description: At present I am pursuing my Master's degree in Computer Engineering from Virginia Tech
main.bio:
A master's in Computer Engineering student at Virginia Tech, I am a technology enthusiast. I strongly believe in the language-agnostic approach and am ready to develop solutions in newer and efficient technologies. 
Currently, as a part of my master's journey, I am delving deep into computer systems and systems programming - exploring the LLVM compiler and the Linux kernel.
 Having 3+ years of work experience in web/app development, I am proficient in backend development using Node.js, with a knack for frontend development using React. Being involved in projects delivering end to end B2X solutions to customers, I believe in the importance of creating modular, clean, and testable code and can vouch for the efficiency of the Agile methodology. 
Please feel free to reach out to me using my email-id listed below or any of the linked social sites!
main.contactmessage: Here is where you should write your message to readers to have them get in contact with you.

resume.skillmessage: I am an explorer and tinker with a variety of tech, but these are the programming skills which I use most frequently at work/personal projects.

work.company: Systems Software Research Group, Virginia Tech
work.title: Graduate Research Assistant
work.description:
• Optimizing the security of userspace applications by developing bi-directional fuzzers. 
 • Developing kernel modules and syzkaller definitions to target the kernel network interface driver.

work.title: Senior Software Engineer
work.description:
• Part of the Research & Development team of Communications Business Unit, responsible for developing IPs and Patents for the company. 
 • Created software solutions for telecom and IT use-cases as a Full-stack and Blockchain developer which have been showcased at Barcelona in Mobile World Congress 2018, as well as, 2019. 
 • Led the backend team for developing the blockchain-based Mobile Number Portability solution, which aimed to eliminate middlemen by decentralizing the porting process using the Hyperledger Fabric platform. 
 • Created efficient backend systems by using caching, content management frameworks, optimized REST APIs, and modeling database schemas.

projects.title: ISO 9660 File System
projects.category: An implementation to perform higher-level operations (reading a file) using the low-level block I/O operations in UEFI. Reads the ISO file, and loads the kernel into memory.

projects.title: Static Heap Analyzer
projects.category: An intra-procedural static heap analyzer to detect liveness of heap data, implemented in llvm.

projects.title: Bootloader
projects.category: Implemented a basic bootloader with a dedicated kernel and userspace

projects.title: LLVM optimizations
projects.category: Implemented several LLVM optimization and transformation passes.

projects.title: Stock-tracker app
projects.category: A dashboard to track the price of your stocks, in real-time.
